result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel M Wade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Cash bail to be returned to poster. 
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.
Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

-No contact with victim unless approved by the agent.
-3rd Party contact regarding arranging time with children as approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.

-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
Pay supervision fees.

-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens if AODA assessment requires treatment.

Defendant Daniel M Wade in court, in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SES.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time dating back to 6/4/2017 for each count, consecutive; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

OPD advises court by phone that counsel will not be appointed for Defendant for hearing regarding condition time. Public Defender will not be present for Probation Review Hearing 6/27/2017 at 8:30 AM in Branch 21.

forwarded to JUDGE DAVIS, BRANCH 21
for review. ew

Bail Refund packet, Check issued April 24, 2017.

Defendant Daniel M Wade in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Court addressed bad Justice Point report with the defendant. Court held colloquy with the defendant. 

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for  21 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.


AS TO COUNT 3: 
The court sentenced the defendant to 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-AS TO EACH COUNT, serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens if AODA assessment requires treatment.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim unless approved by the agent.
-3rd Party contact regarding arranging time with children as approved by the agent. 
-Obtain/maintain employment/schooling or combination of both.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay supervision fees. 
-Cash bail to be returned to poster. 
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept and any applicable collection procedures. 
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.


Filed: 

-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review Hearing in Branch 21.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel M Wade in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and upon motion of the state, Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3: 
  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

 
Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 


Case adjourned to branch 21 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.
